intro: Crotalaria kerrii, commonly known as the kerri’s cowpea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Crotalaria kerrii is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial in agricultural settings. However, some species within the genus are known to be toxic, so caution is advised when handling or consuming any part of the plant.
